# Programming in Excel (iv): Applications of Excel programming

This is a short lecture covering three applications of Excel programming.


0. Raising errors. A recap of errors and how to raise them [Lecture notes.](https://github.com/BI-DS/ELE-3915/blob/main/slides/lecture07/00_constructing_error_functions.xlsx)
1.  `TAKEWHILE`: A function that takes rows from an array until a predicate vector is `FALSE`. [Lecture notes.](https://github.com/BI-DS/ELE-3915/blob/main/slides/lecture07/01_application_1_takewhile.xlsx)
2.  `GROUPBY`: A pattern used to group and aggregate data. [Lecture notes.](https://github.com/BI-DS/ELE-3915/blob/main/slides/lecture07/02_application_2_groupby.xlsx)
3.  Dynamic dropdows: How to make multiple dropdown lists where one depends on the other. [Lecture notes.](https://github.com/BI-DS/ELE-3915/blob/main/slides/lecture07/03_application_3_dynamic_dropdowns.xlsx)
